Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery vessel; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of crane (with added red on wing), facing right; probable human figure to left of bird; part of further object top right, and perhaps the foot of an antithetic figure; below, a band and further black area.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 129, pl. XXXIX, no. 358.5)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 233, no. 188)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1996)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4775 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
